content:
Add Messaging to the Service Console

Configure the Service Console to put all messaging tools at your agents’ fingertips. Add Omni-Channel, customize the Messaging Session page layout, and make the Send Message global action available.

This article applies to: Messaging for In-App, Messaging for Web, standard and enhanced WhatsApp, standard and enhanced Facebook Messenger, standard and enhanced SMS, enhanced Apple Messages for Business, and Bring Your Own Channel

To create or edit a console app:

Customize Application
AND
View Setup and Configuration

When adding the Enhanced Conversation component to the Messaging Session page layout, decide which actions are visible to agents and customize other component settings.

In the Lightning App Builder, open the Messaging Session page layout and click the Enhanced Conversation component.
Configure the component properties in the Properties pane.
Hide transfer action: Don’t show agents the option to transfer messaging sessions to another agent, queue, or flow.
Hide emoji action: Don’t show agents the option to send emoji.
Hide quick text action: Don’t show agents the option to send quick text.
Hide flag raise action: Don’t show agents the option to raise a flag requesting help from a supervisor.
Hide file attachment action: Don’t show agents the option to attach files.
Hide messaging component action: Don’t show agents the option to send messaging components.
Hide voice message action: Don’t show agents the option to record and sent voice messages.

To send most messaging components, agents click the messaging component action in the messaging window and select a component. However, agents must run a flow to send messaging components with dynamic content, such as time selectors or components that rely on parameters. 

Group all messaging component flows as subflows within one larger flow. When an agent runs the flow, they select the relevant sub-flow to insert the messaging component they need.

SEE ALSO

Set Up a Flow to Send Time Selectors in Messaging Sessions
Set Up a Flow to Send Questions with Options in Messaging Sessions
Send Messaging Components in Messaging Sessions
title: Configuring Service Console for Messaging
